parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To know beforehand, foreknow. From pro and ginosko; to know beforehand, i.e. Foresee.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From ano; from above; by analogy, from the first; by implication, anew.
To witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report. From martus; to be a witness, i.e. Testify.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Most exact, strict. Superlative of akribes; most exact.
From haireomai; properly, a choice, i.e. a party or disunion.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 1st Person Plural
str2: Our, our own. From thnetos; our.
From a derivative of threskos; ceremonial observance.
